website_summaries.verdict: A solid choice for blending jobs that don't require a powerful mixer or blender.
pros: Easy to use, disassemble, and clean
Has 5 speed settings and 5 attachments to easily tackle a variety of basic blending jobs
cons: Not practical for thick or solid foods
Lacks the power of a traditional blender or hand mixer

customer_reviews.title: Release your inner chef
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a hand blender for a long time. But waited and waited... you get the idea. Saw this set and knew I had nothing to lose by trying it. Now I'm making things in the kitchen with so much ease and control I was never able to do before. The whisk, brilliant. The chopper, my food processor now only comes out for big projects. Ever put hot soup in the blender to cream it? Ouch! Now it never leaves the pot. And the awesome milkshakes!!! The wife was skeptical but not anymore. I'd like to give it 6 stars. Update 2.5 years later and still going strong. Still very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Marlboro Man

customer_reviews.title: I wanted this to be the one
customer_reviews.text: Powerful, quiet, powered through frozen strawberries easily (unit is rated for chopping ice). Lasted one month before the drive shaft middle portion died. Waiting for a weekday to call and see if the warranty process is as smooth as claimed in the warranty statement. Update 10/2/18 Called number in warranty document. A replacement unit is on the way. I was told by call center representative that "only a tiny amount of ice or frozen fruit" should be blended at once.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Herman

customer_reviews.title: Nice but Expect to Buy Replacement Parts
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly useful but there are quality issues. After a year of light use the interconnect on the blending arm failed and after another six months the interconnect on the whisk attachment failed. A careful look at the blending arm failure revealed that though the interfaces themselves look like they were designed to make a strong connection, when mated the two sides barely overlap so the gear on the arm simply stripped because there wasn’t enough plastic to handle the pressure on the gear. Looks a lot like Kitchen Aid choose to save a few cents on the length of the connecting rod as the expense at the expense of durability. I assume the same if true of the whisk attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Toaster

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, feels and acts cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality compared to other hand blenders I've had before. The motor isn't that powerful, the clearance on the blender attachments makes hard work of soups, the mini chopper lids doesn't fit properly so it leaks, the connection between wand/attachments and the motor unit is poor and loose so the blender can fall into your pot and there are too many metal to plastic connections which make it look and feel cheap whilst also wearing the plastic rapidly. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: ericsmiley

customer_reviews.title: Not very powerful and a box of un-necessary tools
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace a submersible blender that I bought in 2003. The motor finally just quit after years of excellent service. I bought this KitchenAid version because I have generally had good performance from their products. This hand blender comes with a wide variety of attachments but does not deliver a fundamentally powerful basic motor/blender. i've tried it 3 times and it just isn't up to the basic blending that I used to be able to do. I will return it tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and buy a cheaper one
customer_reviews.text: Kitchenaid has put all of their money into looks and presentation rather than functionality. I bought this one because it has a small countertop veggie chopper. Silly me, I put some carrot pieces in it and all it did was spin merrily around in the container. I do wish I had just bought an ordinary immersion blender instead of this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Pippi Longstocking

customer_reviews.title: Plastic gears can strip with blending frozen fruit smoothies.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this hand blender and have used it everyday to make my smoothies with frozen fruit. Today, the plastic gear stripped in the blending arm. I don't know why they would put a plastic piece in that place, but they do and it broke. I called KitchenAid and they are replacing the entire unit for me. Which is why I only took one star off my recommendation. I will now keep in mind to not use it with frozen fruit. It works great with the chopping attachment and for blending soups.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Let’s put it this way I find any reason to use this in my kitchen. I love the adaptability of this hand blender. I use it for whipped cream to pancakes to cutting vegetables for omelettes plus many other things. Only gripe is that the plastic adjustment knob at the top doesn’t turn super easy and feels like it will be the first thing to break on this. Kitchenaid needs to definitely fix this part to keep up their quality products.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Weaver

customer_reviews.title: $100 tool for small jobs only.
customer_reviews.text: Fine for whisking, pureeing in a bowl. NOT for food processing, as the container attachment misleadingly suggests. See my photos, for 1 minute of trying to chop-up a carrot. The biggest advantage of this device is that you can use "one bowl" for prep work, instead of cleaning out a second food processor bowl, but the motor is very weak.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: Short life span
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hand blender 2-years ago and use it about 2-3 times per month (less than 100 times). The motor died suddenly in the middle of blending and the only thing Kitchen-Aid could do is help me find a local repair center which I would have to pay for the repair or offer me a discount on a replacement and the discount was minimal. I would save more money by going to Bed Bath & Beyond and purchase another kitchen-aid item on sale with one of the 20% off coupons. It may be time to upgrade to a countertop blender or food processor.
customer_reviews.author: jojojo

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this five-speed blending said
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this five-speed blending said, as I have owned almost every KitchenAid appliance in the past and was replacing a 22 year old broken one. Here are some issues that I found in my first week of using it: 1. The blending head is drawn to the bottom of the container by suction. 2. Attachments don’t stay locked so the blade head falls off in whatever I am blending. 3. Case design- Lid does not stay shut and attachments can be difficult to remove when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Tritsch

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY! Kitchenaid doesn't repair it!
customer_reviews.text: That is the worst blender that I ever have. It has weak potency, attachments that don't work well, and EXPENSIVE. With almost not use, it stopped to work, and Kitchenaid doesn't repair it. Read carefully: KITCHENAID DOESN'T REPAIR IT!. After many hours talking with them through the phone, that was their final answer. So, please; don't waste your money!. Don't buy this trash!
customer_reviews.author: LiFe

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 5 1/2 years, replacement parts not available
customer_reviews.text: We had thought that the Kitchen Aid brand and premium price would result in reliability and support, the parts started wearing out after 5 years. First the extension arm, and most recently the S-blade attachment. We found that Kitchen Aid no longer supports the product, with limited availability of very expensive replacement parts available online. The base mixer is still runs fine, but we don't want to throw more money buying the mixing parts at a price that is over half of a complete new mixer from another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Meets all my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to blend soups in the pot. Works great and I love the guard that protects the pot from scratches. Easy to use and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie K

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes mom does know best..
customer_reviews.text: actually I purchased this for our son who lives in Huntsville, AB. He asked me for a mixer but with 2 'dudes' who are ardent gamers and have buddies over frequently, I upped his request to this as it offers so much more. He absolutely LOVES this - gets tons of uses out of the other applications too! Sometimes mom does know best ......
customer_reviews.author: bookworm48

customer_reviews.title: Size of hands matter
customer_reviews.text: I had hoped to write a better review as I felt confident in my purchase by reading reviews and comparing the accessories which accompanied the unit. What I found was that my hands are small and the main handle unit was too heavy for me. It was awkward to hold the power unit down while using. The power level twist on top of unit was not easy to turn nor was it easy to read. I ended up having to go to a local store to try others. I opted for the Braun Multiquick 7 and it has worked well due to the ergonomic design and the ability to use the full grip to control unit and speed.
customer_reviews.author: htoly

customer_reviews.title: Good hand blender
customer_reviews.text: As an immersion blender, it blends soup very well, but it does have its drawbacks. As other reviewers have said, the 5 speeds are controlled by the knob at the top and it took both hands and effort to move the knob. It comes with the accessories, but they currently are taking up space in my cabinet. The positives for this blender are the five speeds, the pot protector shield, the relatively long cord and the storage case. Next time, just a blender without the accessories will be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Purple Moxie

customer_reviews.title: Use this for so many things!
customer_reviews.text: I love this KitchenAid hand blender. It does literally everything. It chops, blends, whips, puree's etc....... I use it when making homemade yogurt to thoroughly blend all ingredients. Use for making soups and sauces. Use for making shakes and smoothies. Couldnt' be without the pitcher and chopper. And case keeps it all together.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Ann

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working.  Quality poor
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit weak in power to start with.. But 5 months into usage.. It's busted. My old Braun lasted years.. And was half the price. Kitchenaid seems to be a brand rather than a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: vasi fam

customer_reviews.title: BAD OUT OF BOX!
customer_reviews.text: It's so much larger than my old cuisinart that finally gave up. When it came in I was amazed at how not compact it and the case is. I could not use it out of the box as two of the parts were cross-threaded during assembly. I had to return it the next day and try again. This put out a big red flag for me that if the quality control suffered this kind of issue on the final assembly then I would only find more troubles down the road. I was happier finding something less bulky and easier to store the attachments and case (huge).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on it!!
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased it back on Feb and its already broken. we barely used it for making a favorite smoothie and soup. the material quality is not good as its claim. Its easy get stuck while chopping vegetable because the blending power is zero and fluids can get its way inside the attachable pieces. the bottom line its not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blending arm is very delicate
customer_reviews.text: Great and rapid delivery from Amazon - We mainly use for baby food preparation - however after only 2 months, the main blending Arm literally broke. The actual mechanism is so fragile that it couldn't handle the necessary strength to rotate. Again, no heavy duty, just ordinary baby vegetable blending. Utterly dissapointed - will not be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro Aguirre Saez

customer_reviews.title: Not Great for Smoothies
customer_reviews.text: The product comes in a nice case and is easy to handle. However, it does not seem powerful enough for making smoothies that include ice or frozen ingredients. It is probably best used for making soups or recipes where the ingredients are already soft. The plastic "bowl protector" broke on the third use. I would not buy it again but will most likely find other uses for it beyond making smoothies.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Attachments don’t work
customer_reviews.text: The attachments on this product are not sturdy. They do not lock into place which makes them very hard to use. The product has started smoking when used on speed one. I thought this was going to be a great stick blender but it turned out to be a waste of money. Make sure you get the warranty that comes with it so that all repairs can be covered. The settings are very difficult to change as well.
customer_reviews.author: DECHIA BRUMFIELD

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing. It won’t last!
customer_reviews.text: Buy a cheaper brand! This kitchenAid is very disappointing and won’t last anyway. It broke after 1 year and I only used it few times. The plastic melt.
customer_reviews.author: Visia T

customer_reviews.text: This is being returned. I have used a KitchenAid red 2 speed hand blender for years. This was just a disappointment for me because the "chopper" wouldn't stay together. I had to physically "hold" it together and try to mix or chop at the same time. Do you know how awkward that is, not to mention when it came apart and everything came pouring out I will go back to my 2 speed I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Nini

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and dangerously flawed. Fire hazard!!
customer_reviews.text: This Kitchen Aide Hand Blender is worthless and dangerous! Used three times to blend fresh salsa then last time to blend pear butter. The blender became very hot after less than a minute and seemed to get hotter just being plugged in. Unplugged and let cool then plugged in again and blend got hot without even using and didn’t even work!! Way to much money for poor product!
customer_reviews.author: Lauri Mathieson

customer_reviews.title: Broke on second use.
customer_reviews.text: Item broke on the 2nd use - due to a design defect. The plastic on the blending arm was chewed by the metal on the blade attachment where they meet. Currently trying to get Amazon to provide a refund so I can buy a better model. This was my wife's birthday present, so she's not amused either.
customer_reviews.author: Varghese George

customer_reviews.title: Amazing blender and comes with many great attachments
customer_reviews.text: Just got this Wednesday and have already used it to make butternut squash soup, smoothies and more. Very easy to clean and the way the blades are designed, it hasn't scratched my pots. VERY easy to use. VERY easy to add different attachments and happy I went with KitchenAid. (Plus it matches all my other Kitchen aid accessories).
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Get it. It’s worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this product. It lives up to the Kitchen-Aid name with quiet power, ease of use & impressive versatility. Great job, Kitchen Aid! I bought the Kitchen Aid 5-Speed handheld immersion blender to replace our old Dualit immersion blender that started smoking during use. The Kitchen Aid is so much more than a great immersion blender—it is going to replace our Ninja Smoothie blender, the smoking DuaLit immersion blender and the Oster hand mixer. Bonus on the mini food chopper- that is a convenience I didn’t realize we needed!
customer_reviews.author: BRyan Veilleux

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this KitchenAid hand blender and was so pleased with it, we bought another for our sister's birthday. It's solidly built, has several speed options, and all sorts of attachments. It's really several tools in one! I've used it to make guacamole, salad dressings, smoothies, and blend soups right in the pot (cream of broccoli, asparagus, cauliflower, etc.). I love that it came in it's own case so the parts don't get lost in a drawer. I would definitely purchase it again, as a gift, but do not expect I'll need to replace mine for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: It was an impulse buy that I only used once....
customer_reviews.text: Nobody in my family could figure out how to use the extra attachments & chopping things. It's been sitting in my kitchen for months unused... we are foodies... it's just a huge hassle to use. Either I received a faulty product, or I we couldn't figure out how to put the machine together with a lot of the attachments. I feel like I should have been given a video tutorial on how to use it instead.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Airaksinen

customer_reviews.title: Broken pitcher
customer_reviews.text: So excited to receive this product, until I opened and the pitcher was cracked right down to the bottom of it. Everything else seems fine. Just disappointing to get something your so excited to receive and part of it is broken especially when you pay good money for it!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Tanguay

customer_reviews.title: Chopper did not work well after a couple of uses
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t meet my expectations. Besides the chopper blade was not working properly after a couple of uses. Not recommended
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke 3 times during 2 years of use
customer_reviews.text: I have had this blender for just less than 2 years. It was used almost daily, until the motor quit last week. The wand part was replaced under warranty twice during the 2 year period also. Because I got such great support from KitchenAid on the broken wand, I called them in the dead motor. They couldn't help me because it's warranty had expired. Perhaps I should consider this a disposable appliance and be happy I almost got 2 years out of it, but I'm just disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MDJ

customer_reviews.title: Just get an individual hand blender, the chopper is useless.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this set until the chopper piece, which is the piece I use the most (to chop up onions and pure tomatoes only) stopped and wouldn't spin the blades. I called the customer service and got a replacement. However the replacement didn't even last as long as the original. I'm very frustrated and disappointed. The original lasted maybe 6 months and the replacement even less.
customer_reviews.author: BigShopper

customer_reviews.title: Reminder this  is cheap product Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: Read recent reviews anyone - Purchased in 2016 used very little and stopped working. Gear or something inside must have stripped puree vegetable soup. Surprised how quickly it became useless .
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Cardillo

customer_reviews.title: I wanted a standard kitchen model and this model is perfect. I don't really know the difference between the ...
customer_reviews.text: I own a large commercial stick blender for my soaping needs but when it comes to mashing potatoes or blending a soup, I wanted a standard kitchen model and this model is perfect. I don't really know the difference between the various blade heads as I haven't used them that much. It's seen about 4-5 uses total but when I did use it I loved its performance. I missed in the ad where it indicated it came with a handy case to keep all the parts together and organized, LOVE THAT!! I can stand it up in the upright organizer in the pantry next to cookie sheets and baking dishes.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Nice hand blender!
customer_reviews.text: I love this hand blender. It's easy and fast for me to make anything. Mix, pulverize, mince, beat eggs, and puree smoothies, sauces, baby food, soups, and much, much more. The product is of good quality, including many accessories and a storage box. I like this one very much. It is also easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: mandy

customer_reviews.title: Better than Cuisinart
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the new Cuisinart version has an annoying safety feature that makes you press 2 buttons to run it. This blender has more attachments than I need but it has the one-button start that I like. I also like the variable speed. The copper doesn't seem to work all that great at chopping nuts but the stick blender part is great.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: PIECE OF JUNK!!!
customer_reviews.text: I knew this item seemed too good to be true! The second time I used it the blade section ( the blender comes in three pieces which one must connect in the preferred configuration...) fell of not once, but three times, rendering the tool completely useless. Of course, the window for returning it closed months ago, after all, who uses an immersion blender that often? I will try to contact Kitchen Aid, but am not too optimistic about getting a return refund on the damn thing. Piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Woman

customer_reviews.title: No spare parts for this product
customer_reviews.text: I had this and used it 3 times total before the blending arm stripped, no spare parts for this product are available so if yours strips, KitchenAid tells you that you are SOL, and should not have let it strip. No clue how to prevent stripping of the cheap plastic drive gear in a hand blender that that only goes together 1 way, but what do I know? I'm just an idiot that spent $150 on something designed to fail.
customer_reviews.author: Robbin the Hood?

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid Hand Blender
customer_reviews.text: It's a great blender with lots of attachments that fit and work very well. I'm very impressed with it. The one thing I don't like is that the speed control is at the top and very smooth, which makes it very difficult to adjust especially if your hands are oily or wet or have something on them. If the top was serrated or had a knob, or something to grip onto it would be perfect. I hope KitchenAid reads these reviews! Thanks, T
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Food Chopper Attachment is Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Generally, this hand blender works well. Relatively straight forward to use, and a nice packaging to house the components. However, the food chopper / mini food processor component has a critical design flaw. The housing lets water in, but cannot be cleaned or disassembled, meaning that it gets very gross over time, potentially dangerous. If you want that feature, go for a different option.
customer_reviews.author: Kat L.

customer_reviews.title: Not the Kitchen Aid quality I expected. This is CRAP!
customer_reviews.text: This does not deserve the Kitchen Aid name. The quality is not there. The pieces come apart easily. I had firmly locked the blending head on the shaft. It came off while I was blending. The motor, even on high has little torque. Even though I got this at half price, I sent it back after one use. I hope this is not representative of what Kitchen Aid has become. (I truly love my 40 year old stand mixer.)
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kueker

customer_reviews.title: ‘other’  brands are inferior
customer_reviews.text: I just love this. They really put their thoughts in when designing this. I like this stick mixer, over others, because. After use, when the mixer is dirty, the blade part of the mixer, detaches. So, if you are doing two jobs at the same time. Each one can have its own blade. Also, it sure makes clean up more easy. The cordless model of this mixer is like three times more money. Of course, it might be more free without a cord. But given the choice, this corded model, or some ‘other’ cordless model. I am glad to have this one. I’ve had the ‘other’ cordless brands. And they are inferior.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Solid Kitchen product
customer_reviews.text: Originally got this for blending our morning coffee, now it's our Go-To kitchen tool. So unbelievably easy to switch out attachments. Dishwasher safe. Only slight frustration experienced when trying to adjust speed on head. Sometimes I can get it to turn easy, sometimes difficult but Great product overall.
customer_reviews.author: C&SA

customer_reviews.title: Quality blender set
customer_reviews.text: Looks really attractive. Blades are sharp, I accidently nicked my pinkie and sliced it while being careless. Attachments lock securely and easily. Changing attachments is quick, and they are dishwasher safe. The included plastic blender in my set came with a small crack less than an inch in total length in the rim. It's not through and through, and doesn't affect performance. I haven't used the blender yet, so I can't vouch for performance, but I'm satisfied with what I've seen so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Five stars
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use. Clean up is quick. I have been using this blender for two months and it’s going strong. I make my toddler smoothies with frozen fruit and this thing blends right through everything with no problem. I do not have to chop anything up a head of time. So far it’s been great.
customer_reviews.author: Heather S

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy construction
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few weeks ago to replace an older model that had lived its life. I have used it a few times. It does what it is supposed but the material compared to the older version is flimsy plastic on the handle instead of metal additionally the base that attaches the motor to the chopper unit fills up with water when washed and doesn’t drain properly.
customer_reviews.author: JHech

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this purchase. The kit includes everything that you would ever use in the kitchen and the case although plastic is well made and all of the attachments fit very nicely and are secure. It has surpassed my expectations and I would recommend it as a necessity in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: PBW

customer_reviews.title: Wife approved
customer_reviews.text: purchased for wife's use in making smoothies, sauces and other items. The system is very nice and the enclosed plastic organizer for the parts is great at keeping everything organized and together. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: PURDUE98

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and design well for the task at hand.
customer_reviews.text: I love this blender, excellent quality and design well. I own many KitchenAid products for many years never have any issues with this company. Never require any assistance nor do I have any issues with their products.
customer_reviews.author: MadDog616

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to my kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: Having used my share of commercial immersion blenders, I find this unit to be comparable if not superior in many ways. First and foremost this is a light, powerful, but controlable tool with some real handy features. The grip is comfortable to hold, the switch is placed in a convenient location and solidly built. The only feature I would like to see additionally is a thumb switch for the variable speed versus the smooth rotary dial on the top. Overall, if you are familiar with immersion blenders you will be happy with this purchase.....if not, you will wonder what you did without one.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: More powerful than my 280 Watt Braun Hand Blender
customer_reviews.text: All I wanted to add to the other reviews that praise this blender is that even though it may use less Watts than my 280 Watt Braun Vario Hand Blender, it is definitely more powerful (torque-wise). It can blend thick pastes that my Braun got stuck in. My Braun finally burnt out when I tried to blend some chunky bird suet into a softer paste that I needed to add cayenne pepper to so the squirrels wouldn't eat it. The Kitchen Aid 2561 had no problem tackling the bird suet. I am very impressed with the power of its motor.
customer_reviews.author: Research Nut

customer_reviews.title: I BOUGHT IT ON SALE!
customer_reviews.text: I love my immersion blender,I have an older Cuisenart, I use regularly but this (new) one I've hardly touched has some awesome attachments I can't wait to learn to use! This sucker has enough to keep you learning...
customer_reviews.author: Po'rider

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about durability since I haven't had it long. I was very happy with how it works and has done all that I need it to accomplish. Loving it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Miller

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy the one with the food processor/chopper
customer_reviews.text: The food processor doesn’t chop anything. I have tried herbs and garlic. It barely does anything. I had to chop by hand. It seems that the blades don’t go far enough into the bowl. Disappointed with the food processor part but the blender works fine. Great for pureeing soup in the pot.
customer_reviews.author: MCK

customer_reviews.title: Crushes ice
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this blender, it is used nearly every day and I make chai smoothies with ice! YES it crushes ice in your smoothie, I only wish it came with a second bowl attachment. The top of the bowl blender is not submersible so that is the hardest part to clean, but it's a breeze to use and so very versatile. Keto cooking household so lots of use here
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good handmixer... just comes apart sometimes
customer_reviews.text: This is the first hand mixer I’ve ever purchased. Over all I love this product. However I have noticed that the attachments sometimes come loose while using. This makes it a hassle to continue mixing until the attachments are cleaned up and reattached.
customer_reviews.author: TheFahFamily

customer_reviews.title: Parts will not lock in place.
customer_reviews.text: The mixer is comprised of 3 parts: Motor, shaft, and blending head. None of the parts actually lock in place!!! The motor is very powerful and tends to cause the blending head to detach when you move it around. Poor design, plastic gears , but very powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Could Use Work
customer_reviews.text: It works well, and it's better than most, but there are a few design flaws. The knob on the top is the speed controller, and it's difficult to turn and cumbersome when you're using it. The power cord needs something holding it out of the way as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Harnach

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for wedding gift for my daughter and her hubby. They love it. He is an excellent at home chef and she is a good cook. They love it for their soups and can't wait to try it for other things!
customer_reviews.author: Mayor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect kitchen tool that should be in every kitchen!  Can't do without it!!
customer_reviews.text: OMGoodness, can't do without this! I've even purchased this for my daughter in law which she uses it more than I do! We love both love it! Blending soups, dips and more! Great job!
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Poor design, do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: Unlike my prior cuisinart immersion blender, this one has plastic gears to connect the motor with the attachments. So they stripped in a few months, and now the blender is worthless because the motor cannot grip onto the attachments. Major design flaw, and should have been obvious to the engineers.
customer_reviews.author: E.R.

customer_reviews.title: The platic “chrome” was very shocking
customer_reviews.text: Feels very cheap, but seems to work ok so far
customer_reviews.author: Gomer Hat

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I love how quick it works and there is less clean up than using a full size blender. I use it daily to mix up thicker protein shakes. I normally add fresh fruit and have used frozen as well. It blends nicely. It may not blend as well as a Vitamix but for small jobs, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: HomeschoolMom

customer_reviews.title: Quality and on well built mixer and blades with organizer
customer_reviews.text: As always quality product. The blender is well built and has different mixing blades that easy to replace. It comes with small food chopper and mixing bottle. And most important it comes with organizing case that will save your space and keep you kitchen neat.
customer_reviews.author: E Haj

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed by this hand blender. Compared to the one it replaces. It adds a 5 speed rotary knob, a chopper attachment, a larger blending pitcher with a rubber ring on the base so it doesn't spin on the counter when in use, a whisk, a 8 & a 13" blending arm, 3 mixing blades, a pan guard for Teflon ware, a bell guard, and storage container. Plus it's quieter, and faster.
customer_reviews.author: JST

customer_reviews.title: Keep Looking!
customer_reviews.text: Shame on me! I should have watched the video that clearly shows a cord! When it showed up I was instantly upset seeing the cord but I was like, "This will be ok, it should have plenty of power!" Well the power was ok, but not what you would expect for a plug-in. The "1" star comes in for the use of plastic for the gears in shafts and heads of the attachments which are already breaking making them unusable!
customer_reviews.author: spofs

customer_reviews.title: So good, you will look for reasons to use it.
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I bought this one for the 13 inch shaft. I find it hard to puree soups in the pot with the shorter models. The included chopping bowl works excellent for chopping nuts.or as a small food processor, but easier to clean. Whisk attachment makes quick work of eggs and makes fluffy omelets.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great unit but flawed rotary speed knob.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Really solidly made, powerful motor, neat attachments! I'm really glad I bought the 5-speed. My only complaint is the knob to turn the speeds. It's flush against the top of the handle. It's really really hard to turn! Maybe I'm missing something, but why wouldn't KitchenAid put a regular rotary dial on top? It makes no sense.
customer_reviews.author: SMP

customer_reviews.text: I have the same back home but the one I purchased here has a real problem.the container with a blade for chopping etc is working soooo badly! And it’s making strange noise. It looks like it’s scrubbing itself on the place where we fix the blade... Disappointed with this detail The rest is great
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Love it! I love the milk frother
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I love the milk frother, it makes great hot chocolate! The chopper attachment makes great dips! However, I was making mashed potatoes once and it stopped after a couple of minutes. It still works, but I don't know for how long. Also, the description says 5-speed - there's only one button, and I didn't notice anything different when I press it several times.
customer_reviews.author: Laura C.

customer_reviews.title: More than expected
customer_reviews.text: It comes in a plastic case to keep all the attachments together. I've used it several times and it never ceases to live up to expectations. It could use a slight explanation on which of the immersion blenders works with the ingredients I'm mixing. But trial and error works too. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Terek

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: It mixes, stirs, and blends. that's pretty much it.. it seems sturdy, and looks good. comes in a nice case to keep it all together. good little kitchen accessory.
customer_reviews.author: Paul L Jack

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Very under powered! I have never been disappointed in Kitchenaid products until now. I really love the design of having interchangeable parts but the motor is so weak! Have to send back.
customer_reviews.author: Basenji owner

customer_reviews.title: High Quality.. Beautiful Set
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful high quality set. Its sturdy and with so many extras! Unfortunately I had to return them because I meant to order the long neck set of these which are also available for sale but I clicked the wrong one! I need the longer neck for blending soap and emulsification of lotions. I almost talked myself into keeping these. If you buy these you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J_F

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This immersion blender was just what needed to make my squash soup, soy-free mayo salad dressings and other homemade sauces, soups and condiments. I highly recommend it for easy use, clean up and the great storage case it came in.
customer_reviews.author: Nanna Yinda

customer_reviews.title: So far works on purée but not on chop
customer_reviews.text: Used to purée my soup and was super happy, but when used to chop herbs was a hot mess. The chopper bowl did not work, will try on something else soon, hopefully it will work.
customer_reviews.author: Becky B.

customer_reviews.title: You need one!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. I love that is has a case to keep everything. It’s easy to use and clean. It’s one of my favorite kitchen gadgets. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Raquel Martin

customer_reviews.title: This is the cadillac of immersion blenders
customer_reviews.text: Also does chopping & mixing. I make mayonnaise easily without everything at room temp. Have not used all the pieces yet but I intend it for making hollandaise sauce. It works very well.
customer_reviews.author: AnnGuiles

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen Aid should say it all
customer_reviews.text: You have your stand mixer, but for blending this wand works amazing. Get really for some seriously fluffy egg whites.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Brake

customer_reviews.title: Not KitchenAid type quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for my wife for Christmas when she needed an upgrade on her stick blender and a replacement for her nutribullet. Last week the main attachment broke. Not to mention she's been pretty dissatisfied with how it blends things. This item really isn't a substitute for a good blender.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's ok for simple meal prep
customer_reviews.text: Better if it was cordless and had a bigger mixing cup or bowl etc. My bug hands cant really reach unti it when washing it. Great container that comes with storage wise.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Not Kitchenaid quality
customer_reviews.text: This being the second Kitchenaid immersion blender I've had, was most definitely disappointed. My first one kicked butt and took names until the motor died. This one is much weaker. Will not puree. The attachments are low quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Good immersion blender with lots of extras
customer_reviews.text: This is the first immersion blender I have ever had, so don't have anything to compare to. I love all the attachments that came with it and have used most of them. Has good power. Wish the power button stayed on instead of requiring one to hold it on. Has lots of power and does a good job on creaming soups. The chopper is very useful for small batches that don't require a large food processor.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy A. Crowell

customer_reviews.title: Love Kitchenaid
customer_reviews.text: Really love this. I saw this some where else and it cost a good amount more than what I paid on Amazon. You can do so much with it. And love the pan guards to put on different blades. So won’t scratch
customer_reviews.author: RickandCarol

customer_reviews.title: Well built, works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because the cheap ones I was using kept getting loose or breaking. This feels great in the hand and solid and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth L

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Amazing just like their other products. Bought this years ago and it's still working like it's fresh out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Lockman

customer_reviews.title: The attachments do not stay together blending, as if ...
customer_reviews.text: The attachments do not stay together blending, as if it is stripped. Could blend liquid maybe but with even softened food comes apart.
customer_reviews.author: fam C.

customer_reviews.title: Convenience
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient to use and allows you to process or mix your meals, or what you are making right in the pot. It avoids an additional step in the food preparation process.
customer_reviews.author: R. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Not for food processing whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: Overall below my expectations !! Maybe good for puree and soups, but the food processor part is a joke. After trying hard for 15 minutes , my chopped onion pieces are still untouched , maybe only a little bruised on the sides ( I chopped them to very small pieces, almost blackberry-size). Very disappointed !!
customer_reviews.author: Buth

customer_reviews.title: Quality brand.  Works as described.
customer_reviews.text: Wicked cool device to have in the kitchen. Makes quick work of potatoes for whipped/mashed potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Micky

customer_reviews.title: Handy Handheld Blender
customer_reviews.text: I like my hand-held KitchenAid immersion blender. It does the job in no time. I like to use it to blend whole tomatoes into juice. I stick it right down into the jar.
customer_reviews.author: Kent & Julie Hansen

customer_reviews.title: We sent ours back. We ended up purchasing a ...
customer_reviews.text: We sent ours back. We ended up purchasing a hand blender with more power.
customer_reviews.author: angie

customer_reviews.title: Works great for soups and chopping small amounts
customer_reviews.text: Works great for soups and chopping small amounts. It's a whole lot easier to clean up than a regular-size food processor. It did not come with the "removable pan guard" they just included another bell blade assembly cover. I cut the bottom out of it and it works just fine....otherwise I'd give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G.

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far... haven't even used it for what I got it for (to make salad dressing). I use the whisk attachment for pancakes alot and have used another one for mixing. The food processor also works well. I have been throwing all the attachments in DC dishwasher but didnt look to see what they recommend.... haven't broke yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica M.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband just bought this for me and I love it so far. I only have used it once so far but now I am looking at thing I can make just so I can use it. It is heavy duty. Easy to use. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: I'm an idiot.
customer_reviews.text: Not powerful enough. Parts look cheap, feels more like a toy. The knob on top to change speed is very slippery if your hands are not clean. It takes twice as long to blend as my previous broken blender did. I should have just gotten the same one I had. I'm an idiot.
customer_reviews.author: Dimpitidoopie

product_meta.title: KitchenAid KHB2561CU 5-Speed Hand Blender - Contour Silver
product_meta.description:
Color:Contour SilverThe 5-Speed Hand Blender is one countertop appliance with limitless options and versatility. The 8-Inch blending arm reaches perfectly into deeper pots. The Industry's First Interchangeable Bell Blade Assemblies can be easily changed with no tools required; Simply twist off and on to switch from one bell blade assembly to another. The S-blade is ideal for blending, the multi-purpose blade crushes ice and the frother/beater blade froths milk. Also included, a whisk and chopper attachment for even greater versatility.

BRAND STORY
By KitchenAid
feature_bullets: Removable 8" Blending Arm locks into the motor body for easy operation when blending in deeper pots.

The Industry's First Interchangeable Bell Blade Assemblies offer limitless versatility for any culinary task. Three interchangeable bell blade assemblies allow you to easily crush ice, puree soup, froth milk and so much more.
The Whisk Attachment can be used to quickly whip egg whites to fluffy peaks and cream or emulsify vinaigrettes and mayonnaise. Top-rack dishwasher safe.
2 1/2-Cup BPA-Free Chopper Attachment with lid locks is ideal for chopping herbs, nuts, cheese, cooked meat and more right in the convenient chopper bowl.

1-Liter BPA-Free Blending Pitcher is the perfect container to use when blending double batches of smoothies or baby food. The pitcher features a convenient handle and no-splash lid. Top-rack dishwasher safe. Electrical: 60 Hz

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,721 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
